title: Equipment
fullText:
Electrical equipment shall be checked that â€”
(a) it exhibits no mechanical damage or deterioration, arcing and there is no evidence of overheating;
(b) the covers are not broken or missing giving access to live parts or basic insulation. Where basic protection is provided by barriers or enclosures, removal shall require use of a tool or key;
(c) electrical equipment in damp areas have the correct ingress protection (IP) rating and are appropriate for the zone and environment; and
(d) fixed appliances are in good working condition.
NOTE This includes hand-held appliances, such as permanently connected hairdryers.
The use of double adaptors, extension cords and electrical portable outlet devices (EPODs) should be discouraged.
